instruction: What metric was chosen to evaluate the accuracy of the models in the analysis of soil salinity in the Ebinur Lake Wetland National Nature Reserve, and how well did it perform?
Output:
The metric chosen to evaluate the accuracy of the models in the analysis of soil salinity in the Ebinur Lake Wetland National Nature Reserve was R-2 (R-squared). The R-2 value measures the proportion of the variance in the dependent variable (soil salinity) that can be explained by the independent variables (spectral indices). 

The DE-SVM model performed the best among the three models, with an R-2 value of 0.56. This indicates that the model can explain 56% of the variance in soil salinity based on the spectral indices. 

It is important to note that while an R-2 value of 0.56 is considered moderate, it suggests that there is still a significant amount of unexplained variance in the soil salinity. Therefore, further improvements and refinements to the model may be necessary to increase its accuracy in estimating soil salinity.

instruction: What machine learning algorithms were used to validate the constructed spectral indices for measuring soil salt content in the Ebinur Lake Wetland National Nature Reserve?
Output: The machine learning algorithms used to validate the constructed spectral indices for measuring soil salt content in the Ebinur Lake Wetland National Nature Reserve were particle swarm optimization support vector machine (PSO-SVM), gray wolf optimization support vector machine (GWO-SVM), and differential evolution support vector machine (DE-SVM).
